sense.name: (cause to) be disclosed or disseminated, usually anonomously
sense.examples: Someone in the administration leaked the New York subway story. Daniel Ellsberg leaked the Pentagon Papers, the U.S. military's account of activities during the Vietnam War, to The New York Times. She and her record company leaked the tracks on the Internet deliberately.

sense.name: allow fluid to escape or enter as through a hole or fissure
sense.examples: The waterbottle is leaking. Gas leaked into the basement. After we moved in, we discovered that the roof leaks.
